snippet: Amid the AIDS epidemic, gay marriage wasn’t even on the radar, say some gay men who lost partners and friends.
abstract: Many middle-aged gay men find that the passage of New York's same-sex marriage law in June 2011 rekindled their grief from the darkest days of the AIDS epidemic, when they lost innumerable friends and loved ones to a disease that was often as stigmatizing as it was deadly.
lead_paragraph: Amid the AIDS epidemic, gay marriage wasn’t even on the radar, say some gay men who lost partners and friends.

headline.seo: AIDS Casts a Shadow Over Gay Marriage Victory
headline.main: Gay Marriage Victory Still Shadowed by AIDS
headline.print_headline: Gay Marriage Victory Still Shadowed by AIDS
